help.body:
You can define a custom filter simply by selecting the Filter by attribute attribute according to which we want to search and the corresponding operations ( Filter operations ).

If you need to create a more complex filtering criterion, you can use this script.
The example below shows the situation where we want to filter by the selected attribute and operation (it enters the script as filter ), but we want to limit the results to another condition. In this case, so that all results must have the attribute "lastname " (by schema) equal to "Doe". 

 import eu.bcvsolutions.idm.ic.filter.impl.IcFilterBuilder; 
 import eu.bcvsolutions.idm.ic.api.IcAttribute; 
 import eu.bcvsolutions.idm.ic.impl.IcAttributeImpl; 
 
 IcAttribute attr = new IcAttributeImpl ("lastname", "Doe"); 
 
 return IcFilterBuilder.and ( filter, IcFilterBuilder.equalTo (attr));

IcFilterBuilder provides operations

  • IcFilterBuilder.equalTo(...)
  • IcFilterBuilder.contains(...)
  • IcFilterBuilder.startsWith(...)
  • IcFilterBuilder.endsWith(...)
  • IcFilterBuilder.or(...)
  • IcFilterBuilder.and(...)
  • IcFilterBuilder.not(...)
The output of this script must be IcFilter. If null is output, then the filter will not be applied and synchronization will be run over all accounts.

protectionEnabled.help: Enables account protection before deletion. When trying to remove an IdM account (last relation assigning this account), it will be marked as 'Is protected'. Such an account will not be deleted or provisioned. To really delete the IdM account (and thus the account on the end system), it will occur after the expiration of the protection interval. Deleting performs a scheduled task.

attributeMappingDetail.infoPasswordMapping: Beware, is chosen attribute with a password. While first creating an object at the end of the system will be generated one value (according to password policies), which will be sent to all attributes labeled as 'Password attribute'. This value will be sent into script as a GuardedString object. The output of the script must be GuardedString, or null. The corresponding attribute in the system schema must also be a GuardedString or String type. When changing a password, a new password is sent to all of these attributes.

uid.label: Identifier
uid.tooltip: Attribute is unique identifier of object.

sendOnlyIfNotNull.label: Send IdM value only if its not null
sendOnlyIfNotNull.tooltip: Value for this attribute (computed by CzechIdM), will be sent on target system only if value is not null.

sendAlways.label: Send always
sendAlways.tooltip: Value for this attribute will be always send on target system. Even if is not changed.

disabledAttribute.label: Disabled
disabledAttribute.tooltip: Disabled attribute will not be used in provisioning in default state. It can still be overload and activated in roles.

cached.label: The value is cached
cached.help: The attribute value will be saved and read from the cache. At this moment, it is used only in sync. The key is this attribute and attributes from the end system (IcAttribute). The value is the transformed value from the end system.

sendOnPasswordChange.label: Include on password change
sendOnPasswordChange.help: Send this attribute into provisioning, when password is changed.

sendOnlyOnPasswordChange.label: Include only when password is changed
sendOnlyOnPasswordChange.help: The value of the attribute will only be sent to the target system when the password is changed. It will not be used in standard provisioning.

passwordAttribute.label: Attribute with password
passwordAttribute.help: Attribute will contain value of password. The attribute can't be override by role mapping. Into transformation will be add password in object GuardedString. Script must return null, or GuardedString.

passwordFilter.label: Active password filter
passwordFilter.help: The password filter is active on the system

echoTimeout.label: Timeout (seconds)
echoTimeout.help: After creating an echo record, all the same password change requests are marked as echo in the defined timeout.

transformationUidScript.label: Transformation script for identifier from system
transformationUidScript.help: Script find identity in IdM by given identifier from system. Returned must be IdmIdentityDto.  To script is given these parameters: 'system' the system from which the password change request came, 'username' identifier given from system, 'logIdentifier' log identifier that connects request from pasword filter with IdM and 'systemAttributeMapping' which contains an attribute mapping in which the password filter setting in IdM is defined.

name.label: Name
name.help: User-defined name of this system attribute, overloaded by the role.

transformScript.label: Transformation to system
transformScript.help: Allows to transform value from CzechIdM to state intended for connected system. Input parameters of this Groovy script are attribute value 'attributeValue', IdM entity 'entity' and account identifier 'uid'. If script output value is null, than returning value is available account identifier (uid).

customFilter.label: Use custom filter
customFilter.help: Synchronization will be managed by custom filter defined below. When not selected, synchronization is managed by connector mechanisms. The filter is NOT used during reconciliation.

filterAttribute.label: Filter by attribute
filterAttribute.help: This attribute (with type of filter operation) will be used as default filter criteria for synchronization. Other criteria can be defined in filter script.

customFilterScript.label: Custom filter
customFilterScript.help: This Groovy script sets own search filter for accounts in system to be synchronized.

rootsFilterScript.label: Definition of tree roots
rootsFilterScript.help: This Groovy script sets definition of tree root. Script input is 'account' (IcObject). Output must be Boolean ('true' for root). Without script implementation, every element without parent is consider as root.

reconciliation.label: Reconciliation
reconciliation.help: Executes full reconciliation instead of synchronization. Synchronization will be executed for all accounts without filter. Search for missing accounts will be executed for all entities in CzechIdM.

differentialSync.label: Process only differences
differentialSync.help: Performs entity update and provisioning only if at least one change in a value of the mapped attributes is found.

changeInIdm.helpBlock: Password change for the password filter definition will be also made through IdM.

quoting.label: Name Quoting
quoting.help: Select whether database column names for this resource should be quoted, and the quoting characters. By default, database column names are not quoted (None). For other selections (Single, Double, Back, or Brackets), column names will appear between single quotes, double quotes, back quotes, or brackets in the SQL generated to access the database.

host.label: Host
host.help: Enter the name of the host where the database is running.

port.label: Port
port.help: Enter the TCP port number the database server is listening on.

user.label: User
user.help: Enter the name of the mandatory Database user with permission to account table.

password.label: User Password
password.help: Enter a user account password that has permission to access accounts table.

database.label: Database
database.help: Enter the name of the database on the database server that contains the table.

table.label: Table
table.help: Enter the name of the table in the database that contains the accounts.

keycolumn.label: Key Column
keycolumn.help: This mandatory column value will be used as the unique identifier for rows in the table.

passwordcolumn.label: Password Column
passwordcolumn.help: Enter the name of the column in the table that will hold the password values. If empty, no validation on resource and passwords are activated.

statuscolumn.label: Status Column
statuscolumn.help: Enter the name of the column in the table that will hold the status values. If empty enabled and disabled operation wont be performed.

disabledstatusvalue.label: Disabled Status Value
disabledstatusvalue.help: Enter the value for disabled status. Default is "false".

enabledstatusvalue.label: Enabled Status Value
enabledstatusvalue.help: Enter the value for enabled status. Default is "true".

defaultstatusvalue.label: Default Status Value
defaultstatusvalue.help: Enter the value for status in case of status not specified. Default is "true".

jdbcdriver.label: JDBC Driver
jdbcdriver.help: Specify the JDBC Driver class name. Oracle is oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver. MySQL is org.gjt.mm.mysql.Driver. PostgreSQL is org.postgresql.Driver. Could be empty if datasource is provided.

jdbcurltemplate.label: JDBC Connection URL
jdbcurltemplate.help: Specify the JDBC Driver Connection URL. Oracle template is jdbc:oracle:thin:@%h:%p:%d. MySQL template is jdbc:mysql://%h:%p/%d. PostgreSQL template id jdbc:postgresql://%h:%p/%d, for more info, read the JDBC driver documentation. Could be empty if datasource is provided.

enableemptystring.label: Enable writing empty string
enableemptystring.help: Select to enable support for writing an empty strings, instead of a NULL value, in character based columns defined as not-null in the table schema. This option does not influence the way strings are written for Oracle based tables. Default is "false".

rethrowallsqlexceptions.label: Rethrow all SQLExceptions
rethrowallsqlexceptions.help: If this is not checked, SQL statements which throw SQLExceptions with a 0 ErrorCode will be have the exception caught and suppressed. Check it to have exceptions with 0 ErrorCodes rethrown. Default is "true".

nativetimestamps.label: Native Timestamps
nativetimestamps.help: Select to retrieve Timestamp data type of the columns in java.sql.Timestamp format from the database table. Default is "false".

allnative.label: All native
allnative.help: Select to retrieve all data type of the columns in a native format from the database table. Default is "false".

validconnectionquery.label: Validate Connection Query
validconnectionquery.help: There can be specified the check connection alive query. If empty, default implementation will test it using the switch on/off the autocommit. Some select 1 from dummy table could be more efficient.

changelogcolumn.label: Change Log Column (Sync)
changelogcolumn.help: The change log column store the latest change time. Providing this value the Sync capabilities are activated.

datasource.label: Datasource Path
datasource.help: Enter the JDBC Data Source Name/Path to connect to the Oracle server. If specified, connector will only try to connect using Datasource and ignore other resource parameters specified. An the example value is: jdbc/SampleDataSourceName

jndiproperties.label: Initial JNDI Properties
jndiproperties.help: Could be empty or enter the JDBC JNDI Initial context factory, context provider in a format: key = value.

cipheralgorithm.label: Password cipher algorithm
cipheralgorithm.help: Cipher algorithm used to encode password before to store it onto the database table. Specify one of the values among CLEARTEXT,AES, MD5, SHA1, SHA256 or a custom implementation identified by its class name. Default is "CLEARTEXT".

pwdencodetouppercase.label: Force password encoding to upper case
pwdencodetouppercase.help: Force password encoding to upper case. Default is "false".

cipherkey.label: Password cipher key
cipherkey.help: Specify key in case of reversible algorithm.

pwdencodetolowercase.label: Force password encoding to lower case
pwdencodetolowercase.help: Force password encoding to lower case. Default is "false".

retrievepassword.label: Retrieve password
retrievepassword.help: Specify if password must be retrieved by default. Default is "false".

passwordcharset.label: Resource Password Charset
passwordcharset.help: Specify Character set used by resource to encode clear text password. Default is "UTF-8".

host.label: Host
host.help: The name or IP address of the host where the LDAP server is running.

port.label: TCP Port
port.help: TCP/IP port number used to communicate with the LDAP server. The default is 389.

ssl.label: SSL
ssl.help: Select the check box to connect to the LDAP server using SSL. The default is "false".

failover.label: Failover Servers
failover.help: List all servers that should be used for failover in case the preferred server fails. If the preferred server fails, JNDI will connect to the next available server in the list. List all servers in the form of "ldap://ldap.example.com:389/", which follows the standard LDAP v3 URLs described in RFC 2255. Only the host and port parts of the URL are relevant in this setting.

principal.label: Principal
principal.help: The distinguished name with which to authenticate to the LDAP server.

basecontexts.label: Base Contexts
basecontexts.help: One or more starting points in the LDAP tree that will be used when searching the tree. Searches are performed when discovering users from the LDAP server or when looking for the groups of which a user is a member.

passwordattribute.label: Password Attribute
passwordattribute.help: The name of the LDAP attribute which holds the password. When changing an user's password, the new password is set to this attribute. Default is "userPassword".

accountobjectclasses.label: Account Object Classes
accountobjectclasses.help: The object class or classes that will be used when creating new user objects in the LDAP tree. When entering more than one object class, each entry should be on its own line; do not use commas or semi-colons to separate multiple object classes. Some object classes may require that you specify all object classes in the class hierarchy.

accountusernameattributes.label: Account User Name Attributes
accountusernameattributes.help: Attribute or attributes which holds the account's user name. They will be used when authenticating to find the LDAP entry for the user name to authenticate.

accountsearchfilter.label: LDAP Filter for Retrieving Accounts
accountsearchfilter.help: An optional LDAP filter to control which accounts are returned from the LDAP resource. If no filter is specified, only accounts that include all specified object classes are returned.

groupobjectclasses.label: Group Object Classes
groupobjectclasses.help: The group class or classes that will be used when creating new group objects in the LDAP tree. When entering more than one object class, each entry should be on its own line; do not use commas or semi-colons to separate multiple group classes. Some group classes may require that you specify all group classes in the class hierarchy.

groupnameattributes.label: Group Name Attributes
groupnameattributes.help: Attribute or attributes which holds the group's name. Default is "cn".

groupmemberattribute.label: Group Member Attribute
groupmemberattribute.help: The name of the group attribute that will be updated with the distinguished name of the user when the user is added to the group. Default is "uniqueMember".

maintainldapgroupmembership.label: Maintain LDAP Group Membership
maintainldapgroupmembership.help: When enabled and a user is renamed or deleted, update any LDAP groups to which the user belongs to reflect the new name. Otherwise, the LDAP resource must maintain referential integrity with respect to group membership. Default is "false".

maintainposixgroupmembership.label: Maintain POSIX Group Membership
maintainposixgroupmembership.help: When enabled and a user is renamed or deleted, update any POSIX groups to which the user belongs to reflect the new name. Otherwise, the LDAP resource must maintain referential integrity with respect to group membership. Default is "false".

passwordhashalgorithm.label: Password Hash Algorithm
passwordhashalgorithm.help: Indicates the algorithm that the Identity system should use to hash the password. Currently supported values are SSHA, SHA, SMD5, and MD5. A blank value indicates that the system will not hash passwords. This will cause cleartext passwords to be stored in LDAP unless the LDAP server performs the hash (Netscape Directory Server and iPlanet Directory Server do).

respectresourcepasswordpolicychangeafter.label: Respect Resource Password Policy Change-After-Reset
respectresourcepasswordpolicychangeafter.help: When this resource is specified in a Login Module (i.e., this resource is a pass-through authentication target) and the resource's password policy is configured for change-after-reset, a user whose resource account password has been administratively reset will be required to change that password after successfully authenticating. Default is "false".

usevlvcontrols.label: Use VLV Controls
usevlvcontrols.help: Whether to enforce usage of VLV controls over standard LDAP controls. Default is "false".

vlvsortattribute.label: VLV Sort Attribute
vlvsortattribute.help: Specify the sort attribute to use for VLV indexes on the resource. Default is "uid".

uidattribute.label: Uid Attribute
uidattribute.help: The name of the LDAP attribute which is mapped to the Uid attribute. Default is "entryUUID".

readschema.label: Read Schema
readschema.help: If true, the connector will read the schema from the server. If false, the connector will provide a default schema based on the object classes in the configuration. This property must be true in order to use extended object classes. Default is "true".

basecontextstosynchronize.label: Base Contexts to Synchronize
basecontextstosynchronize.help: One or more starting points in the LDAP tree that will be used to determine if a change should be synchronized. The base contexts attribute will be used to synchronize a change if this property is not set.

objectclassestosynchronize.label: Object Classes to Synchronize
objectclassestosynchronize.help: The object classes to synchronize. The change log is for all objects; this filters updates to just the listed object classes. You should not list the superclasses of an object class unless you intend to synchronize objects with any of the superclass values. For example, if only "inetOrgPerson" objects should be synchronized, but the superclasses of "inetOrgPerson" ("person", "organizationalperson" and "top") should be filtered out, then list only "inetOrgPerson" here. All objects in LDAP are subclassed from "top". For this reason, you should never list "top", otherwise no object would be filtered. Default is "inetOrgPerson".

attributestosynchronize.label: Attributes to Synchronize
attributestosynchronize.help: The names of the attributes to synchronize. This ignores updates from the change log if they do not update any of the named attributes. For example, if only "department" is listed, then only changes that affect "department" will be processed. All other updates are ignored. If blank (the default), then all changes are processed.

modifiersnamestofilterout.label: Filter Out Changes By
modifiersnamestofilterout.help: The names (DNs) of directory administrators to filter from the changes. Changes with the attribute "modifiersName" that match entries in this list will be filtered out. The standard value is the administrator name used by this adapter, to prevent loops. Entries should be of the format "cn=Directory Manager".

accountsynchronizationfilter.label: LDAP Filter for Accounts to Synchronize
accountsynchronizationfilter.help: An optional LDAP filter for the objects to synchronize. Because the change log is for all objects, this filter updates only objects that match the specified filter. If you specify a filter, an object will be synchronized only if it matches the filter and includes a synchronized object class.

changelogblocksize.label: Change Log Block Size
changelogblocksize.help: The number of change log entries to fetch per query. Default is "100".

changenumberattribute.label: Change Number Attribute
changenumberattribute.help: The name of the change number attribute in the change log entry. Default is "changeNumber".

filterwithorinsteadofand.label: Filter with Or Instead of And
filterwithorinsteadofand.help: Normally the the filter used to fetch change log entries is an and-based filter retrieving an interval of change entries. If this property is set, the filter will or together the required change numbers instead. Default is "false".

removelogentryobjectclassfromfilter.label: Remove Log Entry Object Class from Filter
removelogentryobjectclassfromfilter.help: If this property is set (the default), the filter used to fetch change log entries does not contain the "changeLogEntry" object class, expecting that there are no entries of other object types in the change log. Default is "true".

synchronizepasswords.label: Enable Password Synchronization
synchronizepasswords.help: If true, the connector will synchronize passwords. The Password Capture Plugin needs to be installed for password synchronization to work. Default is "false".

passwordattributetosynchronize.label: Password Attribute to Synchronize
passwordattributetosynchronize.help: The name of the password attribute to synchronize when performing password synchronization.

passworddecryptionkey.label: Password Decryption Key
passworddecryptionkey.help: The key to decrypt passwords with when performing password synchronization.

passworddecryptioninitializationvector.label: Password Decryption Initialization Vector
passworddecryptioninitializationvector.help: The initialization vector to decrypt passwords with when performing password synchronization.

statusmanagementclass.label: Status management class
statusmanagementclass.help: Class to be used to manage enabled/disabled status. If no class is specified then identity status management wont be possible.

retrievepasswordswithsearch.label: Retrieve passwords with search
retrievepasswordswithsearch.help: Whether to retrieve user passwords when searching. The default is "false".

groupsearchfilter.label: LDAP Filter for Retrieving Groups
groupsearchfilter.help: An optional LDAP filter to control which groups are returned from the LDAP resource. If no filter is specified, only groups that include all specified object classes are returned.

readtimeout.label: Read Timeout (Milliseconds)
readtimeout.help: Time to wait for a response to be received. If there is no response within the specified time period, the read attempt will be aborted. Value 0 or less than 0 means there is no limit.

connecttimeout.label: Connection Timeout (Milliseconds)
connecttimeout.help: Time to wait when opening new server connections. Value of 0 means the TCP network timeout will be used, which may be several minutes. Value less than 0 means there is no limit.

quoting.label: Name Quoting
quoting.help: Select whether database column names for this resource should be quoted, and the quoting characters. By default, database column names are not quoted (None). For other selections (Single, Double, Back, or Brackets), column names will appear between single quotes, double quotes, back quotes, or brackets in the SQL generated to access the database.

createscriptfilename.label: Create script filename
createscriptfilename.help: Path to a script file creating an account.

reloadscriptonexecution.label: Reload script on execution
reloadscriptonexecution.help: By default scripts are loaded and compiled when connector instance is created. If true script is loaded and compiled every time it is called. Warning use only for testing/debugging, because this can slow application.

deletescript.label: Delete script
deletescript.help: Enter a script (code) for account deletion.

deletescriptfilename.label: Delete script filename
deletescriptfilename.help: Path to a script file deleting an account.

cleartextpasswordtoscript.label: Clear text password to script
cleartextpasswordtoscript.help: Select if password should be passed to scripts in clear text.

autocommit.label: Auto commit
autocommit.help: If set to true, each SQL query is treated as a transaction and every change is commited to database right after execution.

searchscriptfilename.label: Search script filename
searchscriptfilename.help: Path to a script file for searching in the system.

updatescriptfilename.label: Update script filename
updatescriptfilename.help: Path to a script file for account update.

scriptinglanguage.label: Scripting language
scriptinglanguage.help: Scripting language, only value GROOVY is currently supported.

schemascriptfilename.label: Schema script filename
schemascriptfilename.help: Path to a script file for schema generation.

syncscript.label: Sync script
syncscript.help: Enter a script (code) for account synchronization.

searchscript.label: Search script
searchscript.help: Enter a script (code) for account search.

updatescript.label: Update script
updatescript.help: Enter a script (code) for account update.

testscript.label: Test script
testscript.help: Enter a script (code) for connection test.

testscriptfilename.label: Test script filename
testscriptfilename.help: Path to a script file for connection test.

syncscriptfilename.label: Sync script filename
syncscriptfilename.help: Path to a script file for account synchronization.

createscript.label: Create script
createscript.help: Enter a script (code) for account creation.

host.label: Host
host.help: Enter the name of the host where the database is running.

port.label: Port
port.help: Enter the TCP port number the database server is listening on.

user.label: User
user.help: Enter a database user with permission for the account table.

password.label: User Password
password.help: Enter the User's password for database access.

database.label: Database
database.help: Enter the name of the database on the database server that contains the account table.

jdbcdriver.label: JDBC Driver
jdbcdriver.help: Specify the JDBC Driver class name. Oracle is oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver. MySQL is org.gjt.mm.mysql.Driver. May be empty if a data source is provided.

jdbcurltemplate.label: JDBC Connection URL
jdbcurltemplate.help: Specify the JDBC Driver Connection URL. Oracle template is jdbc:oracle:thin:@[host]:[port(1521)]:[DB]. MySQL template is jdbc:mysql://[host]:[port(3306)]/[db], for more info, read the JDBC driver documentation. May be empty if datasource is provided.

enableemptystring.label: Enable writing empty string
enableemptystring.help: Select to enable support for writing an empty strings, instead of a NULL value, in character based columns defined as not-null in the table schema. This option does not influence the way strings are written to Oracle based tables. By default empty strings are written as a NULL value.

rethrowallsqlexceptions.label: Rethrow all SQLExceptions
rethrowallsqlexceptions.help: If this option is not checked, SQLExceptions with ErrorCode 0 thrown by SQL statements will be caught but suppressed. Check it to have exceptions with ErrorCode 0 rethrown.

nativetimestamps.label: Native Timestamps
nativetimestamps.help: Select to retrieve Timestamp data type of the columns in java.sql.Timestamp format from the database table.

allnative.label: All native
allnative.help: Select to retrieve all data type of the columns in a native format from the database table.

validconnectionquery.label: Validate Connection Query
validconnectionquery.help: There can be specified the check connection alive query. If empty, default implementation will test it using the switch on/off the autocommit. Some select 1 from dummy table could be more efficient.

datasource.label: Datasource Path
datasource.help: Enter the JDBC Data Source Name/Path to connect to the Oracle server. If specified, connector will only try to connect using Datasource and ignore other resource parameters specified. The example value is: jdbc/SampleDataSourceName

jndiproperties.label: Initial JNDI Properties
jndiproperties.help: Could be empty or enter the JDBC JNDI Initial context factory, context provider in a format: key = value.

sourcepath.label: Source path
sourcepath.help: Absolute path of a directory where the CSV files to be processed are located

filemask.label: File mask
filemask.help: Regular expression describing files to be processed (e.g. ".\.csv" includes all csv files)

encoding.label: File encoding
encoding.help: Basic encoding of the file (e.g. UTF-8)

fielddelimiter.label: Field delimiter
fielddelimiter.help: Delimiter used to separate fields in CSV files. Default is ",".

textqualifier.label: Text qualifier
textqualifier.help: Delimiter to determine beginning and end of text in value. Default is ".

keycolumnnames.label: Key column name
keycolumnnames.help: Name of the column used to identify user uniquely

passwordcolumnname.label: Password column name
passwordcolumnname.help: Name of the column used to specify user password

deletecolumnname.label: Delete column name
deletecolumnname.help: Name of the column used to specify users to be deleted

quotationrequired.label: Value quotation required
quotationrequired.help: Specify if value quotation is required. Default is true.

ignoreheader.label: Ignore header
ignoreheader.help: Specify if first line of the file must be ignored. Default is true.

keyseparator.label: Key separator
keyseparator.help: Character used to separate keys in a multi-key scenario. Default is ",".

multivalueseparator.label: Multi value separator
multivalueseparator.help: Character used to separate values in a multi-value scenario. Multivalue is unsupported if not provided.

defaultstatusvalue.label: Default Status Value
defaultstatusvalue.help: Enter the value for status in case of status not specified. Default is "true".

disabledstatusvalue.label: Disabled Status Value
disabledstatusvalue.help: Specify a value for disabled status. Default is "false".

enabledstatusvalue.label: Enable Status Value
enabledstatusvalue.help: Specify a value for enabled status. Default is "true".

statuscolumn.label: Status Column name
statuscolumn.help: Specify name of column with status.

requiredconfirmation.label: Required confirmation by the implementer
requiredconfirmation.help: If not checked, then all requests will be solved immediately. No notification will be sent to implementers.

implementers.label: Implementers
implementers.help: Requests for implementing changes on the real system will be created for these implementers. Every implementer must be an identity in CzechIdM.

implementerroles.label: Roles of implementers
implementerroles.help: All identities with these roles will be implementers. Every role must be a role in CzechIdM.

attrs-to-get.label: Returns attributes (ATTRS_TO_GET)
attrs-to-get.help: Defines which attributes will be returned. This definition overloads the definition on a attribute schema (return by default).

page-size.label: Page size (PAGE_SIZE)
page-size.help: Defines the number of records in one response.

newusercontainer.label: Container (OU) for creating new users
newusercontainer.help: DN of the container (OU) into which the newly created user accounts will be inserted.

searchusercontainer.label: Container (OU) with existing users
searchusercontainer.help: DN of the container (OU) from which user accounts will be retrieved.

domaincontainer.label: UPN suffix
domaincontainer.help: Domain name that will be used to calculate the User Principal Name (UPN)

deleteusercontainer.label: Container (OU) for blocked / terminated users
deleteusercontainer.help: DN of the container to which the accounts will be moved typically after the end of the contract.

role-acm-bulk-action.label: Recalculate accounts and provision
role-acm-bulk-action.help: This operation invokes account management for each selected role. The account management will be invoke for all users with the role. Account management itself and subsequent provisioning are performed asynchronously. You can see progress of this operations in the Events agenda.

system-duplicate-bulk-action.label: Duplicate the system
system-duplicate-bulk-action.help: Creates copy of selected systems duplicate contains all configurations. New system (and his syncs) will be inactive.

system-export-bulk-action.label: Export system
system-export-bulk-action.title: Systems
system-export-bulk-action.help: Creates an export batch containing selected systems. The new system will be inactive as well as its sync settings. The resulting export will be saved in the Export/Import agenda.

system-delete-bulk-action.label: $t(action.delete.action) systems
system-delete-bulk-action.help: $t(action.delete.action) selected systems. System must not contains any accounts and unresolved provisioning operations.

acc-remote-server-delete-bulk-action.label: $t(action.delete.action) remote connector servers
acc-remote-server-delete-bulk-action.help: $t(action.delete.action) selected remote connector servers. Server can be deleted, if it is not used for a target system.

acc-system-mapping-delete-bulk-action.label: $t(action.delete.action) mappings
acc-system-mapping-delete-bulk-action.help: $t(action.delete.action) selected mappings. Mapping must not be used in synchronization or provisioning.

acc-system-mapping-duplicate-bulk-action.label: Duplicate the system mapping
acc-system-mapping-duplicate-bulk-action.help: Creates copy of selected system mappings.

acc-identity-account-management-bulk-act.label: Recalculate accounts and provision
acc-identity-account-management-bulk-act.help: This operation invokes account management for each selected users. Account management itself and subsequent provisioning are performed asynchronously. You can see progress of this operations in the Events agenda.

acc-identity-provisioning-bulk-action.label: Provision without account recalculation
acc-identity-provisioning-bulk-action.help: This operation invokes provisioning for each selected users. Provisioning will be performed asynchronously. You can see progress of this operations in the Events agenda.

retrywholebatch.label: Cancel full batch
retrywholebatch.help: Cancel all operations for entity in queue? After uncheck will be canceled only selected operation in queue.

retrywholebatch.label: Retry full batch
retrywholebatch.help: Retry all operations for selected entity by selected operations in queue. All operations for selected entities will be sent to system. Sequence sorted as per time of entering queue. Final state of entities in system will be retained. After uncheck retry only selected operation. Only selected operation will be executed regardless of other records in queue. Sequence of operations may not be followed.

acc-delete-provisioning-archive-long-run.label: Delete archived provisioning operations
acc-delete-provisioning-archive-long-run.help: Delete provisioning operations in archive older than given number of days.

numberofdays.label: Number of days
numberofdays.help: Delete operations older than given number of days.

operationstate.label: Operation state
operationstate.help: Delete operations in given state only.

system.label: System
system.help: Delete operations with given system only.

emptyprovisioning.label: Empty provisioning operations only (without atributes)
emptyprovisioning.help: Delete provisioning operations only without attributes. Operation with DELETE type is not considered as empty (even haven't attributes).

acc-delete-synchronization-log-long-runn.label: Delete synchronization logs
acc-delete-synchronization-log-long-runn.help: Delete synchronization logs older than given number of days.

numberofdays.label: Number of days
numberofdays.help: Delete logs older than given number of days.

system.label: System
system.help: Delete logs on given system only.

acc-account-protection-expiration-long-r.label: Removes accounts with expired protection interval
acc-account-protection-expiration-long-r.help: Removes accounts with expired protection interval. To really delete the IdM account (and thus the account on the end system), it will occur after the expiration of the protection interval.

acc-attribute-controlled-values-recalcul.label: Recalculate values of controlled attributes for provisioning (merge)
acc-attribute-controlled-values-recalcul.help: Recalculate values of controlled attributes with configured merge strategy for provisioning .

acc-cancel-provisioning-queue-long-runni.label: Cancel provisioning queue (deprecated)
acc-cancel-provisioning-queue-long-runni.help: Cancel all active provisioning operations in queue for all systems. This task is deprecated - bulk action can be used directly from active provisioning operation table.

acc-provisioning-queue-long-running-task.label: Process queue of provisioning operations
acc-provisioning-queue-long-running-task.help: Process created active provisioning operations in queue. Active provisioning operation is added to queue, if target system is configured as asynchronous. If no asynchronous system exists, it is not required to schedule this task.

virtualsystem.label: Virtual systems
virtualsystem.help: [All systems...] - all systems, [Yes] - virtual only, [No] - all but virtual.

acc-retry-provisioning-long-running-task.label: Retry provisioning periodically
acc-retry-provisioning-long-running-task.help: Retry failed operations in provisioning queue. Failed provisioning operations are automatically scheduled. This task runs such operations at scheduled time.

wizard.addSystemViaWizard: Create a new system using the wizard
wizard.openSystemViaWizard: Open the system in the wizard

systemDetail.name: System name
systemDetail.help: In this step, select the system name as you want it to appear in IdM.

connector.name: Connector
connector.help: Connector allows communication with an external system. Select the system connector you want to connect. Then fill in the necessary configuration items.

missingConnectorKey.title: Connector not filled!
missingConnectorKey.text: Select the system connector you want to connect!

schemas.name: Schema
schemas.help: The schema represents the structure of the external system. It is generated based on the connector and configuration you selected. If the connector configuration was completed correctly, all you have to do is press the 'Generate the schema' button.

missingSchema.title: No scheme created!
missingSchema.text: Press 'Generate the schema' or create it manually.

mapping.name: Mapping
mapping.help: Mapping determines whether we want to extract data from the external system (synchronization) or write it to it (provisioning). The mapping further defines what type of object we want to work with in IdM (identity, role , contract ...).

provisioningSwitch.label: Provisioning
provisioningSwitch.help: Reads data from the IdM and writes it to the connected system.

syncSwitch.label: Synchronization
syncSwitch.help: Reads data from the connected system and writes it to the IdM.

mapping.entityTypeHeader: What object in IdM do you want to work with?
mapping.operationTypeHeader: Do you want to read data from or write to the connected system?
mapping.alertMoreMappings: The system includes more mappings! This wizard manages only one (oldest) mapping. To view all mappings, go to system detail.

mappingAttributes.name: Attributes
mappingAttributes.help: In attribute mapping, we create a link between an external system attribute and an attribute in IdM.

sync.name: Sync
sync.help: In the sync configuration, we create rules for retrieving data from the external system. You can start sync after completing the wizard on the 'Synchronization' tab right on your system.

summary.name: Summary
summary.text:
Congratulations,

Your new system {{systemName}} has been successfully created.

When wizard done, you will be redirected to the detail of the new system.

mappingSystemOnRole.label: Create a role that assigns this system.
mappingSystemOnRole.help: If you want to assign an account on this system using a role, then you can select it here or create a new one.

newRoleWithSystem.label: Fill in the code for the new role.
newRoleWithSystem.help: If a role with this code already exists, the system will be linked to it.

csv-connector-type.name: CSV file
csv-connector-type.description: The data source is a CSV (Comma Separated Values) file.

csvStepOne.name: CSV connector
csvStepOne.help: In this step, choose the system name as you want it to appear in IdM. Next, select the path to your CSV file that you want to link to as a data source.

dropzone.infoText: You can drag the CSV file here or click for manual selection. The file will be moved to the directory defined above. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.

csvStepTwo.name: Primary attribute
csvStepTwo.help: A schema has been successfully generated from your CSV file. Now you need to choose which of the columns in your CSV is a unique identifier. This attribute will be mapped to the username identity in IdM in the next steps.
csvStepTwo.primarySchemaAttributeId: Choose the primary attribute in the CSV

ad-winrm-connector-type.name: MS AD (WinRM) - Users
ad-winrm-connector-type.description: Allows you to manage users in MS Active Directory.

ad-connector-type.name: MS AD - Users
ad-connector-type.description: Allows you to manage users in MS Active Directory.

stepOne.name: Connection to AD
stepOne.help: In this step, choose the system name the way you want it to appear in IdM. Next, enter the data to access the connected Active Directory.

host.label: Host
host.help: Enter the domain of the connected Active Directory.

user.label: User
user.help: A DN of a user with permission to work in Active Directory.

password.label: Password
password.help: Password of a user with permission to work in Active Directory.

sslSwitch.label: Use LDAPS
sslSwitch.help: Use secure SSL communication to communicate with AD.

sslOffAlert.title: You do not have SSL enabled.
sslOffAlert.text: Not using LDAPS secure communication (SSL), may have functional effects (eg inability to create a password for the user)!

downloadCertificate.label: Download certificate
downloadCertificate.title: Download a certificate to access the Active Directory server.

certificate.title: Certificate of highest authority found:
certificate.text:
• Subject: {{subjectDN}}
  • Cryptographic fingerprint (SH1):{{fingerPrint}}
  • Valid from: {{crtValidityFrom}}
  • Valid until: {{ crtValidityTill}}
Location of this authority's certificate on the IdM server:
{{certificatePath}}

certificatePath.title: Location of this authority's certificate on the IdM server:

noTrustedCertificate.title: Active Directory server is not trusted!
noTrustedCertificate.text: The server's certificate is not trusted. Ensure upload of this CA to the certificate's Java certificate keystore and restart the IdM. This step is now ended!

trustedCertificate.title: The Active Directory server is trusted.
trustedCertificate.text: The server's certificate is currently trusted. A secure connection has been established. You may proceed to the next step.

sslOffAlert.title: Validation and download of certificates against the AD server could not be performed because you do not have SSL communication enabled.
sslOffAlert.text:
Not using LDAPS (SSL) secure communication may have functional implications (eg inability to create a password for the user)!

You may proceed to the next step.

youCanContinue.title: You can go to the next step.

stepThree.name: Permissions
stepThree.help: In this step, we will try to verify that the user you entered has sufficient privileges on AD.

testCreatedUserDN.text: Test user with DN: [{{dn}}] was created successfully.

testDeletedUserDN.text: Test user with DN: [{{dn}}] was successfully deleted.

testAssignedGroupDN.text: The group has been successfully assigned to the test user.

permissionChecked.text: Verification of required permissions was successful. You can proceed to the next step.

testGroup.label: Group
testGroup.help: DN of the group to which the test user will be inserted. By default, the 'Domain Guests' group is searched. If the group could not be found (DN is not filled in), then it is not possible to perform a group assignment permission test.

userContainer.label: Container for inserting test user
userContainer.help: DN of the container into which the test user will be inserted. By default, the 'Users' container is searched, if the container could not be found (DN is not filled in), then for testing purposes, please fill in the existing container.

stepFour.name: Containers
stepFour.help: In this step, fill in the container for loading user accounts and the container for newly created user accounts.

searchUserContainer.label: Container with existing users
searchUserContainer.help: DN of the container from which user accounts will be loaded.

domainContainer.label: UPN suffix
domainContainer.help: Domain name that will be used to calculate the User Principal Name (UPN)

newUserContainer.label: Container (OU) for creating new users
newUserContainer.help: DN of the container into which the newly created user accounts will be inserted.

deleteUserContainer.label: Container (OU) for blocked/terminated users
deleteUserContainer.help: DN of the container to which the accounts will be moved typically after the end of the contract.

pairingSyncSwitch.label: Create a pairing sync
pairingSyncSwitch.help: Creates pairing mappings and synchronizations that allow you to perform initial pairing of accounts in AD and IdM.

jdbc-connector-type.name: Database table connection
jdbc-connector-type.description: Allows you to connect a single database table.

jdbcStepOne.name: Connection to the database
jdbcStepOne.help: In this step, select the system name as you want it to appear in the IdM. Next, enter the data to access your chosen database table and select its primary column.

host.label: Host
host.help: Enter the name of the server on which the database is exposed.

password.label: Password
password.help: Password of a user with permission to work with the table

database.label: Database
database.help: Enter the name of the database on the database server that contains the table.

table.label: Table
table.help: Enter the name of the table in the database that contains the accounts that the connector will work with (synchronization, provisioning).

keyColumn.label: Key Column
keyColumn.help: The name of the column with the unique identifier of the row in the table (usually the same as the primary key).

passwordColumn.label: Password Column
passwordColumn.help: Name of the column that will contain the passwords for the accounts. Leave blank if you do not need to work with passwords (provisioning)

postgresql-connector-type.name: PostgreSQL database
postgresql-connector-type.description: Allows managing a single table in a PostgreSQL database.

mssql-connector-type.name: Microsoft SQL Server
mssql-connector-type.description: Allows managing a single table in a MS SQL database.

mysql-connector-type.name: MySQL database
mysql-connector-type.description: Allows managing a single table in a MySQL database.

scripted-sql-connector-type.name: Scripted SQL connector
scripted-sql-connector-type.description: For managing multiple database tables by using scripts.

CONNECTOR_CONFIGURATION_FOR_SYSTEM_NOT_F.title: Connector was not selected
CONNECTOR_CONFIGURATION_FOR_SYSTEM_NOT_F.message: Connector for system [{{system}}] is not defined. Please, select connector definition in system settings.

PROVISIONING_ATTRIBUTE_MORE_UID.title: Unique identifier already exists
PROVISIONING_ATTRIBUTE_MORE_UID.message: System [{{system}}] has already set unique identifier.

PROVISIONING_BREAK_OPERATION_EXISTS.title: Duplicate brake configuration for the system
PROVISIONING_BREAK_OPERATION_EXISTS.message: Brake configuration for this operation type [{{operationType}}] and system [{{systemId}} already exists.

PROVISIONING_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE_MORE_UID.title: Unique identifier already exists
PROVISIONING_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE_MORE_UID.message: Role [{{role}}] and system [{{system}}] have already set unique identifier.

PROVISIONING_SYSTEM_DISABLED_PROVISIONIN.title: Provisioning of account [{{name}}] wasn't executed
PROVISIONING_SYSTEM_DISABLED_PROVISIONIN.message: Provisioning of account [{{name}}] in system [{{system}}] wasn't executed. System is configured as inactive - without provisioning queue.

PROVISIONING_SYSTEM_DISABLED.title: Provisioning of account [{{name}}] wasn't executed
PROVISIONING_SYSTEM_DISABLED.message: Provisioning of account [{{name}}] in system [{{system}}] wasn't executed. System is configured as inactive.

PROVISIONING_SYSTEM_READONLY.title: Provisioning of account [{{name}}] not executed
PROVISIONING_SYSTEM_READONLY.message: Provisioning of account [{{name}}] in system [{{system}}] wasn't executed. System is in read-only mode.

sync-executor-cache.description: Dramatically speeds up synchronization execution. It prevents reinstantiating of SynchronizationEntityExecutor objects.

provisioning-cache.description: Stores executed provisioning operations. This drastically speeds up provisioning brake. Evicting this cach may temporarilly slow down provisioning execution for systems, which have provisioning brake enabled.

password-filter-echo-cache.description: Cache stores records about processed password changes with password filter (ECHO's). The cache prevents made duplicit password request through IdM and systems.

sync-mapping-cache.description: Cache stores mapped attribute values during synchronization.
